title: Fynn Valley Walk Route

images.title: Robert Edwards / Part of the Fynn Valley Walk footpath
images.caption: Part of the Fynn Valley Walk footpath. Near the Kyson Point National Trust area south of Woodbridge.

images.title: Roger Gittins [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Woodbridge Tide Mill on River Deben. The Tide Mill seen on the right was built in about 1796 where a medieval mill once stood. The mill as one might expect was used to grind corn in flour but was finally used to produce animal feed. When it ground to a halt in 1956 and was the last working tide-mill. To the left you will see the granary where the wheat was stored. The tide mill was restored and opened to the public in 1972. The pond in which tide water was trapped to run the mill became the Yacht Harbour a small pond still exists for demonstration of the mill.

images.title: Adrian Cable / Martlesham Creek
images.caption: The path here runs along the pretty Martlesham Creek just to the south of Woodbridge.

images.title: Barbara Cook / Tuddenham St. Martin
images.caption: Tuddenham St. Martin. The pub is the Fountain, the village sign is characteristic of the area.

images.title: Andrew Hill / Bridge and pub, Tuddenham St Martin
images.caption: Bridge over the river and a riverside pub at Tuddenham St Martin. The Fountain pub is across the River Fynn from the old part of the village and the church.

images.title: Adrian Cable / Witnesham Village Sign & Post Office, High Street, Postbox
images.caption: Witnesham Village Sign and Post Office, High Street, Postbox

description: This footpath runs along the River Fynn from Witnesham to Woodbridge . You will pass the pretty villages of Tuddenham St Martin, Playford, Little Bealings and Martlesham where you join the lovely final section along the Martlesham Creek and the River Deben to Woodbridge, finishing at the train station. The route runs for about 9 miles on a fairly flat path so it's suitable for most abilities. You can continue your riverside walking by picking up the footpath along the River Deben to Felixstowe Ferry on the coast.
